Habit Tracker Visualizer
- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (json, csv, datetime, collections, statistics, curses for TUI).
- Terminal-based app with full keyboard navigation (arrow keys, Enter, Esc, Tab).
- Core feature: Track daily habits (e.g., exercise, reading, water intake) with numeric values (0-10 scale).
- Data model: JSON file "habits.json" storing list of habits and daily logs as dicts {date: {habit_name: value}}.
- Main screen: ASCII bar chart showing 7-day rolling averages per habit (use '#' for bars, scale to 80 cols wide).
- Stats panel: Mean, median, streak count, best/worst days displayed as text table.
- Keyboard controls: Up/Down select habit, Left/Right navigate days, Enter log/edit value, 's' toggle stats, 'q' quit.
- Data entry: Prompt for new habit name or edit current day values (today auto-defaults).
- Persistence: Auto-save to habits.json on every change; load on startup with backward-compatible parsing.
- Import/Export: 'i' import from CSV (date,habit,value format), 'e' export JSON/CSV.
- Offline-first: All data local, no network required.
- Sample startup data: Pre-populate 3 habits (Exercise, Read, Hydrate) with 7 days random history.
- Visual polish: Color-coded bars (green good 7-10, yellow 4-6, red 0-3) using ANSI escapes; clear borders/labels.
- Error handling: Validate inputs, graceful recovery from corrupt JSON (backup to habits_backup.json).
- Testable: Run script, log 5 days data, verify bar chart scales correctly, export matches input.
